DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - To undertake systematic review publish effectiveness investigation treatment patient radiation-induced bowel injury pelvic radiotherapy cancer . - To develop diagnostic treatment algorithm ( base evidence [ available ] expert opinion [ evidence ] ) patient . - To examine test algorithm usefulness establish precise diagnosis patient within context randomized clinical trial . - To examine whether use treatment algorithm deliver treatment specifically target diagnosis improves symptoms quality life patient . - To investigate whether level care deliver patient nurse practitioner specialist consultant gastroenterologist follow algorithm . - To identify symptom healthcare need experienced patient pelvic radiotherapy whether unmet need addition bowel injury . - To determine cost-effectiveness investigation treatment develop patient . OUTLINE : This two-part , multicenter study . - Part 1 : Researchers develop diagnostic treatment algorithm guide health care practitioner management patient radiation-induced bowel injury . The algorithm , base systematic literature review expert opinion , use series simple test establish specific diagnosis target treatment manage patient symptom . - Part 2 : Patients stratify accord tumor site ( urological v gynecological v gastrointestinal ) degree bowel dysfunction measure IBDQ-B score > 10 point normal [ < 60 v 60-70 ] ) . Patients randomize 1 3 intervention arm . - Arm I ( usual care ) : Patients receive advice booklet self-management bowel symptom . Patients whose symptom continue 6 month study enrollment may cross arm II . - Arm II : Patients undergo diagnostic treatment algorithm-led management bowel symptom gastroenterologist . - Arm III : Patients undergo diagnostic treatment algorithm-led management bowel symptom nurse practitioner . Patients complete questionnaire bowel symptom pelvic symptom , quality life , anxiety depression baseline , 6 month , 1 year . Patients also complete questionnaire cost effectiveness diagnostic treatment algorithm usual care .
